PAD_MemoryFragmentPerception01.synopsis: The player sees a disturbance in the air - something's off but they're not sure what it is. (Later, when we come back in Intermezzo, it'll become apparent it was a memory of Orpheus', but at this point all we know is that it feels odd.)

DaisyAD_WispDead.synopsis: Daisy reacts to you killing them in wisp form.
DaisyAD_WispDead.how_to_trigger: Go to Act 1b. Use debug oe cre_gotoastralAttack the wisp and kill it.

Wisp01.synopsis: One liner for Wisp01 in Astral Prison.
Wisp01.how_to_trigger: Teleport to 1065; 34; 328 and click on Wisp01

Wisp04.synopsis: One liner for Wisp04 in Astral Prison.
Wisp04.how_to_trigger: Teleport to 1115; 24; 323 and click on Wisp04

DaisyCaveEntrance.synopsis: The player has a dialog with a disembodied voice of Daisy at the entrance to a cave in the Astral Prism. She is only willing to talk to one player Avatar. No companions.Will add group decision for the leader avatar when it's available.
DaisyCaveEntrance.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_Agoto 1769.975; 32.383; 348.513interact witht he portal

Wisp03.synopsis: One liner for Wisp03 in Astral Prison.
Wisp03.how_to_trigger: Teleport to 1115; 24; 323 and click on Wisp03

Wisp02.synopsis: One liner for Wisp02 in Astral Prison.
Wisp02.how_to_trigger: Teleport to 1065; 34; 328 and click on Wisp02

Daisy.synopsis: Players meet Daisy in person for the first time. Daisy will invite the player to kill them, knowing that Vlaakith has ordered the player to do so. The player will be able to ask Daisy about the astral prison, the Absolute, and why the gith are after them,
Daisy.how_to_trigger: Go to act 1b. Go the security office and accept or refuse Vlaakith's mission. 284; 2; 305SetGlobalOsirisFlag CRE_ChainOfCommand_State_PlanecasterActive Insert the Artefact into the planecaster objectOnce in the astral prison, follow the wisp to its final destination and talk to it.

Entering.synopsis: Once the player has gathered their party and the artefact has been placed on the planecaster in gameplay, this dialogue plays and the party is teleported to the Astral Prism where the party reacts to the environment.
Entering.how_to_trigger: Go to Act 1b --> Inquisitor's room. Place artefact on planecaster. Gather your party.

AD_ReadyCheckFailed.synopsis: Daisy tells you to come back when ready.
AD_ReadyCheckFailed.how_to_trigger: Cancel the Ready check when leaving the astral prison.

DaisyAD_AvatarDies.synopsis: Daisy tells the avatar that they can't die here and she can take care of them. It should explain that it is because we're in the Astral Plane that Daisy can revive us like that.
DaisyAD_AvatarDies.how_to_trigger: Triggers if an avatar dies in the Astral Prison. They are resurrected shortly after and this Daisy AD plays.

PAD_ComingOutOfCave.synopsis: Companions react to the avatar coming back out of the cave.
PAD_ComingOutOfCave.how_to_trigger: VB plays after coming out of the cave in the Astral Prison.Go to Astral prison, enter cave and speak to Daisy, this plays after the dialog when you're back.

DaisyAD_WispDead_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_WispDead_0.text: You prove yourself an unworthy ally.

DaisyAD_WispDead_1.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_WispDead_1.text: You fail because it is impossible.

Wisp01_1.speaker: 031d3803-d87b-4a52-bf3d-75b6d7a03ded
Wisp01_1.text: |The commander's orders are clear: we must protect the globe.|

Wisp04_1.speaker: 9ff83d30-3dc9-4fde-b173-7cc83914baf6
Wisp04_1.text: |Send your leader into the cave, our commander wants a word with them.|

DaisyCaveEntrance_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_2.text: So you came. You just couldn't leave it alone, could you? Your instincts leave much to be desired.

DaisyCaveEntrance_25.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_25.text: But it is not you I wish to speak with.

DaisyCaveEntrance_8.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_8.text: I will only speak with the one in charge.

DaisyCaveEntrance_31.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_31.text: You are not the one I wish to speak with.

DaisyCaveEntrance_13.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_13.text: Come. We will talk in private. Just the two of us.

DaisyCaveEntrance_6.speaker: Player
DaisyCaveEntrance_6.text: I'm not leaving my companions behind.

DaisyCaveEntrance_17.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_17.text: Suit yourself, but only the leader of your group is coming in. I will not allow anyone else.

DaisyCaveEntrance_15.speaker: Lae'zel
DaisyCaveEntrance_15.text: If it must be so, it must be so. Do not fail me. Do not fail us.

DaisyCaveEntrance_32.speaker: Astarion
DaisyCaveEntrance_32.text: Oh, don't look at me. That is all yours.

DaisyCaveEntrance_20.speaker: Wyll
DaisyCaveEntrance_20.text: Go on. I'll keep watch here.

DaisyCaveEntrance_28.speaker: Gale
DaisyCaveEntrance_28.text: By all means, carry on. I'll come running if you need me.

DaisyCaveEntrance_10.speaker: Karlach
DaisyCaveEntrance_10.text: Go on, soldier. If anything goes wrong, I'll come in swinging.

DaisyCaveEntrance_30.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_30.text: Tell me - are you the one in charge?

DaisyCaveEntrance_11.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_11.text: Then enter. We need to talk.

DaisyCaveEntrance_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_0.text: Then come back with the one who is.

DaisyCaveEntrance_19.speaker: Narrator
DaisyCaveEntrance_19.text: *The way is blocked now - for good.*

DaisyCaveEntrance_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of shimmering veil/barrier that prevents player from entering the cave.

DaisyCaveEntrance_12.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_12.text: You are not the one I wish to speak with.

DaisyCaveEntrance_24.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_24.text: I will only have words with the one you answer to - alone.

DaisyCaveEntrance_4.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_4.text: You are the one in charge, aren't you? Come in.

DaisyCaveEntrance_18.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyCaveEntrance_18.text: Are you the one in charge or not?

DaisyCaveEntrance_27.speaker: Narrator
DaisyCaveEntrance_27.text: *Your mind and body are muted on approach. A privacy denser than any stone prevents you from entering.*

Wisp03_0.speaker: 30ff3b73-fd30-4f26-bb8f-1256320add33
Wisp03_0.text: |Our commander will talk to your leader.|

Wisp03_1.speaker: 30ff3b73-fd30-4f26-bb8f-1256320add33
Wisp03_1.text: |Only your leader can go into the cave. No-one else.|

Wisp02_0.speaker: 354fa496-7b3b-4ecd-a46e-7011faba22c2
Wisp02_0.text: |I just work here, protecting the globe.|

Daisy_107.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_107.text: I may have made a mistake trusting you.
Daisy_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Inside the Astral plane, the player spots Daisy, They're fully awake, no dreaming now.InternalNodeContext: Little pan on Daisy looking at the void in front of them before the player walks in and they start talking.NodeContext: Looking at the void, not at the player.

Daisy_129.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_129.text: I told you to stay away from the githyanki. But you just couldn't help yourself, could you?
Daisy_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking back over their shoulder while finishing the line. NodeContext: Looking at the void, not at the player for the first part. Looking back over their shoulder while saying "Could you".

Daisy_75.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_75.text: And now you've come here to murder me.
Daisy_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy turns aournd by the right and faces the player who walks close to them.

Daisy_160.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_160.text: Still, refusing a githyanki queen's orders... That was bold.
Daisy_160.context: NodeContext: With begrudging respect. Looking at the void, not at the player.

Daisy_28.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy turns aournd by the right and with a gesture of the hand, invites the player to come closer.

Daisy_46.speaker: Player
Daisy_46.text: Vlaakith told me you are an agent of the illithid Grand Design.

Daisy_96.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_96.text: I told you I stole the artefact from someone - well, I stole it from Vlaakith.

Daisy_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_0.text: Since then, she has become desperate.

Daisy_151.speaker: Player
Daisy_151.text: Everyone always thinks I want to murder them! I just want to talk.

Daisy_1.speaker: Player
Daisy_1.text: Explain. Now. Or I'll do what I do best.

Daisy_123.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_123.text: Very well. What do you want to know?

Daisy_126.speaker: Player
Daisy_126.text: Why does Vlaakith want you dead?

Daisy_159.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_159.text: Vlaakith wants me dead because I know her secret.

Daisy_116.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_116.text: I told you already. I'm just like you. An adventurer from Baldur's Gate who was infected with an illithid tadpole and seeks to be free of the Absolute.

Daisy_50.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_50.text: I'm just like you. An adventurer from Baldur's Gate that was infected with an illithid tadpole and seeks to be free of the Absolute.

Daisy_34.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_34.text: But unlike you, unlike anyone else in any plane, I know Vlaakith's secret.

Daisy_145.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_145.text: It is a secret so great that if her people ever found out, that would be the end of her rule, the end of her.

Daisy_24.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_24.text: That same secret is how I've been protecting you from the Absolute.

Daisy_35.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_35.text: I can hear your thoughts. You think I'm lying. Vlaakith warned you that I would try to deceive you. But consider this - what reason have I to deceive you? I want the same thing as you - freedom.

Daisy_19.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_19.text: I'm on your side. I have been since the very beginning.

Daisy_112.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy draws a sword offering it to the player  hilt first, inviting them to take it.

Daisy kneels on the ground in front of the player.

Daisy_131.speaker: Player
Daisy_131.text: I told Vlaakith I wouldn't kill you. I meant what I said. Get up.

Daisy_52.speaker: Player
Daisy_52.text: Get up - you won't die today.

Daisy_48.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_48.text: It seems I was right to put my faith in you after all. Thank you.
Daisy_48.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Daisy stands up and stows stows the sword.

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the ground

Daisy_82.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_82.text: Vlaakith will be furious - to make no mention of your githyanki companion.

Daisy_38.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_38.text: The lich queen fears nothing more than the loss of her empire. The knowledge I have of her deception will bring that about.

Daisy_157.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_157.text: Vlaakith will be furious. She fears nothing more than the loss of her empire. The knowledge I have of her deception will bring that about.
Daisy_157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy gives a wry smile.

Daisy_60.speaker: Player
Daisy_60.text: Vlaakith's a goddess. What could you possibly know that would bring down her empire?

Daisy_111.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_111.text: Godlike in power, yes. But with none of the sanctity.

Daisy_140.speaker: Player
Daisy_140.text: If you're such a threat to her, why hasn't she killed you already?

Daisy_61.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_61.text: She is trying her very best to kill me. By sending you.

Daisy_90.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_90.text: Queen Vlaakith is lying to you and your people. You think she knows how mother Gith defeated the Illithid Empire.

Daisy_22.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_22.text: But she does not. If the illithids would ever rise to power again, she would be incapable of stopping them.

Daisy_113.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_113.text: And if her deception were ever to come to light, her impotence, her rule would be over.

Daisy_56.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_56.text: And if her people found out about her impotence, there would be mutiny, revolution, the end of her rule.

Daisy_161.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_161.text: But that very power - the power to resist illithid control - which Vlaakith only pretends to know, is how I've been protecting you.

Daisy_14.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_14.text: I suppose she hoped to extract it from my corpse.

Daisy_11.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_11.text: Since you spared me that fate, she will come for you.

Daisy_156.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_156.text: I did warn you not to come here.

Daisy_42.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_42.text: But that curious streak of yours has brought us this far. I believe you will overcome this, too.

Daisy_130.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_130.text: And yet you did not. I can only assume there was something you felt was worth saving.

Daisy_17.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_17.text: A logical question. But you're not ready for the answer.

Daisy_144.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_144.text: I have delayed long enough. The next attack is overdue, and I can't risk you being caught in the middle of it. I need you out there, searching for the Absolute.
Daisy_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

Daisy_5.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_5.text: You were on the right path - to Moonrise Towers. Return to it.

Daisy_128.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_128.text: I hope you are ready to face Vlaakith's wrath. The entire crèche stands ready to kill you in her name.

Daisy_162.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_162.text: Be warned. The Inquisitor awaits your return from this place with orders to kill you. No doubt the rest of the crèche will join him.

Daisy_83.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_83.text: You must go to Moonrise Towers. That is where the cultists are gathering.

Daisy_8.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_8.text: Vlaakith is lying to her people. She pretends to know how Gith destroyed the mind flayer empire. In truth, she knows nothing.

Daisy_109.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_109.text: If the Illithid Empire were ever to return, she would be incapable of stopping them.

Daisy_150.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_150.text: Vlaakith is lying to the githyanki. They believe she knows how their beloved mother Gith defeated the mind flayer empire.

Daisy_6.speaker: Player
Daisy_6.text: You claim to know a lot about my queen, and yet you present no evidence.

Daisy_4.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_4.text: You stood in her presence yourself. Was it not enough to convince you of her fear? Her desperation?

Daisy_58.speaker: Player
Daisy_58.text: Vlaakith be damned - if she wants you dead, she can kill you herself.

Daisy_99.speaker: Player
Daisy_99.text: Is this some kind of trick?

Daisy_23.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_23.text: I already told you I protect you, that I saved you.

Daisy_25.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_25.text: If this was not enough to convince you, what more is there to say?

Daisy_10.speaker: Player
Daisy_10.text: I'm sorry. I don't want to do this, but I'm more afraid of Vlaakith than I am of you. You have to die.

Daisy_102.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player takes the blade and drives it through Daisy's chest. Daisy reacts with pain.

The player maintains their grip on the sword.

Daisy_43.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: deeply sad

Daisy_142.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_142.text: We could have been so much more. But you had to choose this.
Daisy_142.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Daisy grips the blade. Blood spreads from the wound. They fade into wisps, and vanish into the astral ether.

As Daisy fade the blade loses purchase and the find themselves stabbing empty space.

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: disappointed

Daisy_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: A moment of stillness. Then - Daisy reforms from astral ether kneeling in the spot where they were killed. The player is shocked to see Daisy alive.

Daisy_92.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_92.text: So you are not to be trusted.
Daisy_92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: with an undercurrent of bitter disappointment

Daisy_93.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_93.text: Your fear of Vlaakith consumes you.
Daisy_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy gets to their feet

Daisy_12.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_12.text: A waste. Even now she's preparing her Inquisitor for your death. Not to mention the rest of the crèche. They will kill you on sight.

Daisy_63.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_63.text: See where your distrust of me gets you?

Daisy_97.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_97.text: Go on, then - face them. We will resume our discussion when I am ready to forgive you.

Daisy_71.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_71.text: A waste. Even now she's preparing to kill you. The crèche is ready to destroy you in her name the moment you return there.

Daisy_62.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_62.text: I don't intend to make a habit of conversing with my killer, so I will be brief.

Daisy_86.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_86.text: Your survival depends on mine, and mine on yours. It's less than ideal, but it is where we stand.

Daisy_87.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_87.text: I know a secret that Vlaakith never wants to be revealed.

Daisy_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_2.text: It is the reason she mobilised her people to retrieve the Astral Prism.

Daisy_36.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_36.text: It is why she sent you to kill me. And why she will kill you once you leave this place.

Daisy_94.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_94.text: Since we are both dependent on your ability to survive that, you would do well to remember that without me, you would become a mind flayer.

Daisy_110.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_110.text: Now leave. I have a battle to return to.

Daisy_154.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: regretful (on the player's behalf)

Daisy_133.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_133.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy is shocked. 

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: bitter

Daisy_29.speaker: Player
Daisy_29.text: A goddess asked me to kill you. I have no choice. You have to die.

Daisy_95.speaker: Player
Daisy_95.text: My venerable queen has spoken. You must perish.

Daisy_158.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_158.text: A prison. Commissioned by Vlaakith, built in the Hells. A place for all who threaten her to wilt and die.

Daisy_138.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_138.text: The stuff of nightmares, and no concern of yours. It is enough that Vlaakith hunts me for my knowledge - it is best you remain in the dark else she will hunt you too.

Daisy_79.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_79.text: You see, I know Vlaakith's secret.

Daisy_153.speaker: Player
Daisy_153.text: I haven't come to murder you. I just want to talk.

Daisy_117.speaker: Player
Daisy_117.text: You have some explaining to do.

Daisy_101.speaker: Player
Daisy_101.text: Why did you stop the zaith'isk from removing my tadpole?

Daisy_103.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_103.text: You misunderstand. The zaith'isk was going to kill you. I couldn't let that happen.

Daisy_155.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_155.text: It is the very least of Queen Vlaakith's deceptions.

Daisy_124.speaker: Player
Daisy_124.text: What else is she lying about?

Daisy_37.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_37.text: A secret that I know, and Vlaakith doesn't.

Daisy_114.speaker: Player
Daisy_114.text: I'm not interested in Vlaakith. I'm interested in you - who are you, really?

Daisy_80.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_80.text: There's no lie. I would never lie to you.
Daisy_80.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

Daisy_53.speaker: Narrator
Daisy_53.text: *In spite of your reservations, they're telling the truth.*

Daisy_149.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_149.text: The githyanki had no intention of letting you survive purification. And I had no intention of letting you die.

Daisy_91.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_91.text: And now that you know the truth, what will you do?

Daisy_40.speaker: Player
Daisy_40.text: Try to probe into the figure's mind.

Daisy_9.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_9.text: That was uncalled for. Though, a spell well cast.

Daisy_66.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_66.text: I suppose I can't blame you. You are threatened by the tadpole and you think I prevented you from being cured.

Daisy_118.speaker: Narrator
Daisy_118.text: *A palace of memories opens up to you, separated into segments. Within one segment, you see it - the truth, exactly as the figure said. They saved your life.*
Daisy_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just focus on player face as their mind is blown.

Daisy_51.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_51.text: Must you? Really? If you were going to do it, at least you could have tried harder than that.

Daisy_120.speaker: Player
Daisy_120.text: You are mistaken. I'm here to kill you.

Daisy_65.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy hands player a shortswordNodeContext: Weary

Daisy_49.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_49.text: I already told you I protect you, that I saved you.

Daisy_59.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_59.text: If this was not enough to convince you, what more is there to say?

Daisy_85.speaker: Player
Daisy_85.text: Perhaps I should hear you out.

Daisy_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy puts the sword away

Daisy_30.speaker: Player
Daisy_30.text: Is this some sort of trick?

Daisy_121.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
Daisy_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy hands player a shortswordNodeContext: Weary

Entering_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out to touch the artefact, which is floating above the planecaster.

Entering_14.speaker: Narrator
Entering_14.text: *Heat pulses out of the Astral Prism as it begins to flower.*
Entering_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gaps between the 'plates' of the artefact glow, and the 'plates' of the artefact fracture out and begin to move, shifting faster and faster.

Entering_12.speaker: Narrator
Entering_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: At peak speed, a bright white light engulfs you and the room. Fade to white.

Entering_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player looking out into the Astral plane, a little bit off balance from having been teleported, wide shots to introduce and establish location.

Entering_32.speaker: Narrator
Entering_32.text: *A feeling of belonging stirs within you - a fold in reality, a pocket of the Astral Plane.*

Entering_3.speaker: Narrator
Entering_3.text: *The concentration of psionic force is small but unmistakable - this must be a pocket of the Astral Plane.*

Entering_0.speaker: Narrator
Entering_0.text: *A timeless space, bounded, compressed in a fold - a pocket of Astral Plane.*

Entering_15.speaker: Lae'zel
Entering_15.text: Boundless, timeless - like every dream that ever was, stitched together. It is home.

Entering_9.speaker: Shadowheart
Entering_9.text: It's quite beautiful - though dangerous things often are.

Entering_27.speaker: Karlach
Entering_27.text: Can't believe what I'm seeing. This place is beautiful.

Entering_37.speaker: Astarion
Entering_37.context: NodeContext: A pause before the second beautiful. "Strange, but ... beautiful."

Entering_8.speaker: Gale
Entering_8.text: Quite an oddity to behold... but not without beauty, either.

Entering_21.speaker: Wyll
Entering_21.text: Incredible. It feels like nowhere and everywhere, all at once.

Entering_13.speaker: Lae'zel
Entering_13.text: Incredible - space, unfettered from time. The Astral Plane, just as I've dreamt it.

Entering_25.speaker: Shadowheart
Entering_25.text: Quite a sight. Though I'm not quite sure what sight exactly.

Entering_6.speaker: Karlach
Entering_6.text: It's... beautiful. Gods, what a sight.

Entering_36.speaker: Astarion
Entering_36.context: NodeContext: Looking out over the astral plane, as if you've been transported to space

Entering_16.speaker: Wyll
Entering_16.text: Extraordinary - like a waking dream. Where have we gotten to?

Entering_22.speaker: Narrator
Entering_22.text: *The place is expansive, beautiful, but unfamiliar. Could all this have fit inside the artefact?*

DaisyAD_AvatarDies_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_AvatarDies_0.text: This is not the time or place for death.

DaisyAD_AvatarDies_1.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_AvatarDies_1.text: There will be no death here today.

PAD_ComingOutOfCave_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ComingOutOfCave_0.text: Hells. You look like you've seen a ghost.
